hackathon-description-text: We invite you to join us for an exciting code-a-thon event where we explore innovative way to use VR/AR to solve healthcare issues. The event is powered by Tiphub and sponsored by NewWave Telecom & Technologies as part of Diaspora Demo Summit Code Challenge.
hackathon-eligibility:
We welcome individuals, teams and groups. You can apply with your friends or even colleagues from work!
Team size is a maximum of
hackathon-requirements:
A 
Team members
For the
You're free to ideate your project beforehand, but to be eligible for prizes, all code must be written at the event.
hackathon-rules:
We want the Code-A-Thon to be fun and fair for everyone. Your code should be started from scratch and you may only incorporate outside resources (code, libraries, graphics, etc) that are freely licensed and accessible to all participants equally. 
This is a code-a-thon for coders. While we do welcome other participant, we are expecting some demoable product or scalable idea. There will be opportunity to pair up with others to form a team. 
 
 Submissions judged only on content developed during hackathon period. A note on packages: while we encourage the use of packages to save time, in judging, greater emphasis will be placed on original code, especially for visualizations. 
 All code must be submitted to a repository on Github to verify time of edits.
All teams must deliver a 4 minute presentation, followed by 2 mins of Q&A from the judges and audience. 
 All submissions must be related to healthcare diagnostic and VR/AR.
All attendees, sponsors, partners, volunteers and staff at our hackathon are required to agree with the following 
. Organizers will enforce this code throughout the event. We expect cooperation from all participants to ensure a safe environment for everybody.

Does it solve real life issue
